thread.title: Dendis Nets First Goal, Blue Raiders Fall 2-1 to North Alabama
thread.title_full: Dendis Nets First Goal, Blue Raiders Fall 2-1 to North Alabama

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Dendis Nets First Goal, Blue Raiders Fall 2-1 to North Alabama
text:
Dendis Nets First Goal, Blue Raiders Fall 2-1 to North Alabama
The Middle Tennessee women's soccer team suffered a narrow 2-1 defeat against
North Alabama, despite a promising start with freshman Lexi Dendis scoring her first career goal in the 11th minute. The Blue Raiders dominated early but saw their advantage erased when the Lions equalized just before halftime. In the second half, North Alabama took control with a goal from Anna Fugarino, leaving Middle Tennessee searching for an equalizer that never came. The loss drops the Blue Raiders to 1-3-0 for the season, as they prepare to host Bellarmine this Sunday.
- Middle Tennessee registered 9 total shots, with 5 on target.
- Lexi Dendis scored her first collegiate goal in the 11th minute.
Despite a strong start, the Blue Raiders struggled to maintain their lead and faced two disallowed goals due to offsides, indicating an area needing improvement in their attacking plays.State of Play
- Middle Tennessee is currently on a three-match homestand, holding a record of 1-3-0.
- The team lost to North Alabama, who improved to 2-2-0 with this victory.
The Blue Raiders will face Bellarmine this Sunday, Sept. 1, looking to secure their second win of the season and address their recent scoring challenges.Bottom Line
Despite showing early promise with Dendis' goal, Middle Tennessee needs to enhance their offensive strategy and reduce mistakes, particularly around positional play, to turn their season around.
